name: Hotel Mercure Belo Horizonte Lourdes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed one night in the middle of long drive from Brasilia to Rio. All we needed was good sleep, so I booked a superior, high floor. Ended up on the 11th - not that high, there are 21 floors - but OK, except that the hotel is on a busy street and the sound-proofing (if there is any) is useless. So passing lorries, motorbikes, all get heard. So sleep wasn't very good, so not good value, in my opinion, for almost 500 reais when you count breakfast (= about USD285, or Euros 210,00, at time of writing).
reviews.title: Noise from the street means not good value for money
The hotel doesn´t worth what we pay for it.
reviews.text: The room faced the street, so perhaps if you get a room at the back it's not so bad?

That said, I couldn't disagree more with others about staff - all were very attentive, in my opinion (I speak Portuguese, so maybe that helps). The room we had (1111, with separate bedroom and lounge) was very clean and comfortable, everything worked well, we had a drink at the bar and all was fine, breakfast was a bit expensive but very good (with omelettes to order, etc). Free wifi is good, they charge for parking but not extortionate.
reviews.title: Untrained Staff

reviews.text: But like other Mercures I've stayed in in Brazil (and many other hotels in Brazil, Mercure or not), they need to get some soundproofing and ensure that guests get what often really counts - a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Good business Hotel

reviews.text: Was in Belo for some business and stayed at the Mercure for two nights. Check-in was fine but check-out took forever - two people behind me checked out with the other clerk before I did.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but pricey for what you get

reviews.text: Hotel room was nice and fairly spacious and had a flat screen tv (no ironing board thou). Didn't have a chance to check out any of the facilities. Hotel is located not too far from a bunch of restaurants and bars/pubs. We went to a restaurant called Dadivas (not bad food and really nice decor).
reviews.title: Overpriced and poor service!
Great spot
reviews.text: Overall, it was a nice hotel - nothing special but the price was considerably more than I thought it should be for what we got (the hotel was booked by my client). Although, I learned as my trip progressed that hotels in Brazil are pretty pricey (Rio seemed like NYC prices).

With no doubt, this was the worse hotel I ever stayed in Belo Horizonte, specially for the price. Courtains falling apart,. stained carpet, steril decor were just my first impressions. It got worse with the service that I received.

reviews.text: Very friendly, professional and well trained staff.

Stayed for 2 weeks (business & leisure) and it was a perfect temporary home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Excelent hotel!

reviews.text: Our family had reserved 7 rooms at this hotel, to attend a family event in Belo Horizonte.
reviews.title: Will try to avoid this hotel in the future

reviews.text: We live in Sao Paulo and travelled by car. When we got there they did not want to let us check-in because we did not have our 3 kids passports. They have a policy of not letting adults stay with kids unless they can prove paternity, but in this case it was soooo obvious that we were a whole family group!! Both sets of grand parents, uncles and aunts, etc! And we had our kids school id's, and health insurance cards for all of us. They made us go to the local police station, then to a judge court, and only after neither of them could help produce the document the hotel was asking from us, and after the whole family came down to the lobby to beg with us, they finally let us in... Very stubborn people, clearly no focus on welcoming clients. The rest of the stay was ok, but I will definitely avoid this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Nice option in BH.

reviews.text: Rooms are well equipped with 32" LCD TV and microwave oven. Looks pretty new and mothern. Breakfast is paid but it's worth it. The hotel restsurant is at the lobby, which is the worst part. For a quick business stay its pretty good.
reviews.title: Very well located with confortable rooms

aka: Mercure Belo Horizonte Lourdes Hotel Belo Horizonte
description: Mercure Belo Horizonte Lourdes is the perfect hotel for those who want to be close to everything.Located in the most charming neighborhood of Belo Horizonte and near the main points of the capital of the state, Mercure Belo Horizonte Lourdes offers to guests comfort and elegance.The staff is highly qualified, friendly and eager to tell you what the city has to offer. In addition, Mercure Belo Horizonte Lourdes is perfect option to host your business meeting, since it has Wi-Fi and a modern convention center. The Hotel combines the tradition of a french brand and the famous hospitality of the local people. Come and experience this unique concept of accommodation.
